definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: I've got the stubs from the bus companies to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 至今，那些留下来的公交公司的票根足以为证。

sentences.english: When you get on the transfer bus, just show the bus driver the ticket stub.
sentences.chinese: 当你上了转乘的公共汽车时，就把这张票根给司机看。

sentences.english: There's souvenirs, ticket stubs, all the rest.
sentences.chinese: 有各种纪念品，球票票根。

sentences.english: She studies, frowning, a pair of ticket stubs for a New York City theatre.
sentences.chinese: 她皱着眉细细一看，原来是纽约剧院的两张票根。

sentences.english: Keep special mementos in your journal: event tickets, photographs, flower petals, etc.
sentences.chinese: 将票根，照片，花瓣等特殊的纪念物夹在日记中。

sentences.english: I better hold onto my ticket stub in case you get in before I get back.
sentences.chinese: 我最好拿着我的票根，以防你在我回来之前就进场了。

sentences.english: I’d better hold on my ticker stub in case they won’t let me in.
sentences.chinese: 我最好还是自己拿着票根吧，以防他们不让我进来。

sentences.english: I think money is a counterfoil all the time, in should putting in a society, go.
sentences.chinese: 我一直认为钱就是一把票根，应该投放到社会中去。

definition: to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
machine-readable card that serves as a ticket (Tw)
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
